Message.Title: Specs of GK110-Based NVIDIA Tesla K20 Finally Known
Message.Msg: All in all, NVIDIA has yet to unlock the full potential of the 28nm graphics chip, but offers enough for use in installations like the Oak Ridge Titan Supercomputer (14,592 Tesla K20 graphics processing units will be involved in its creation). At this point, the Santa Clara, California-based company does not need to prove its point anymore, that GPUs can be a great asset in supercomputers. All it has to do is to keep its accelerators in shape, which should be easy in the near term, as all it needs is to unlock those remaining CUDA cores and SMX units. Source: news.softpediaDOTcom/news/Specs-of-GK110-Based-NVIDIA-Tesla-K20-Finally-Known-299899.shtml

Message.Title: The gales of October came early
Message.Msg: The gales of October came early The wind from inside made a tattle-tale sound And the stock broke through all resistance The baggies knew, as the captain did too 'Twas the witch of October come stealin' The Wayne is late and those servers had to wait When the news of October was slashin' As afternoon came it was six points south In the face of a best analyst's downgrade The captain wired he had nuthin’ new coming in And his guidance and stock was in peril

AMD going down is not good for the whole industry. Yes, there is general macro concerns. Yes, there is the tablet craze. But I would place part of the blame of the current PC slowdown on AMD's woes. Without AMD pushing them, intel has not been releasing new better product. Instead, Intc s's been releasing die shrinks with same price points, ala bigger margins, but same performance as last gen. Who the heck will upgrade??? The PC industry is not helping either. they are not introducing new products fast enough. same ole 24" 1080 screens, same ole 17.3" 1600:900 laptop sreens etc. Count me as one who held back: I want to upgrade my 2 yr old laptop, but the new stuff out there are the same thing, not enough a diff for me to fork over my $1k.

Topic.Title: The gales of October came early

Message.Msg: As the big chipsters go, it was slower than most And the crew and bad captain were radio-less

Topic.Title: The gales of October came early

Message.Msg: Does anyone know where the Apple love goes When their attorneys put in their hours? Their buyers all say they'd have made Lappy Bay If they'd put a good warranty behind 'em.
It always feels much better when your neighbor's house also got burglarized.

Message.Title: Google Chromebook made by Samsung $299
Message.Msg: $50 more than the 16GB Nexus 7. Reviews have been favourable. I would definitely doll $50 extra for this "thin, lightweight computing machine".

Message.Title: Total Bond Index fund gave much beter return than NVDA

Message.Msg: powered by Exynos dual A15s. That is in addition of 2 qcom quad A15 phones. Where is Wayne?

Message.Title: NVDA has to step up here.
Message.Msg: Put out some positive news, the stock is getting destroyed here! How about announcing a stock buy back as a first step. It would stem the tide of selling and increase valuation.

Message.Title: All initial online Surface stock sold out in United States
Message.Msg: My only solace will be to see the shorts fry. Even pros are saying the trading in this stock isn't right. Methinks there's something rotten in Denmark. Imagine co. A wants to buy co.B. What would it be worth to lower the price by 2 bucks or 3 on a 600 million share company?

Topic.Title: NVDA has to step up here.

Message.Msg: Buyback or dividend seems like a good idea but I think the opportunity to pick up some good if not great assets at bargain prices is coming soon. Unlike myself Nvidia is keeping it's powder dry!

Topic.Title: How are the 7 inch tablets doing?

Message.Msg: I've been scratching my head on this as well. It's likely that the analyst made a blunder: Nexus 7 is a joint venture with Asus. Could the revenue, if any indication, is only a portion of total sales due to total sales allocation?

Topic.Title: Tim has Cooked Apple - Put A Fork In It: It Is Done

Message.Msg: According to a series of posts on Apple's support page, some Verizon customers with the new Apple smartphone have found that the iPhone 5 is displaying incorrect days and times, WebProNews reported. The first complaint was posted on Sept. 24 by Hyperyellow, who wrote that following the activation of the iPhone 5 on Verizon, the device incorrectly reported that the date was Sept. 26, 2012, while the time was 30 minutes ahead. "I woke up and looked at my phone and had a melt down because my alarm never went off," Hyperyellow wrote. "I hurriedly got ready and looked at the microwave as I ran out, and it was 30 minutes earlier than my iPhone said." The issue seemed to crop up overnight, as the device was in sleep mode and charging (though the commenter didn't specify whether it was plugged into a computer or a wall outlet). According to the complaint, the glitch, which struck twice, also messed with iMessage, "and I'm sure the rest of the date/time dependent apps." Hyperyellow deployed a quick fix — turning off the automatic time settings, which seemed to do the trick. A slew of responses have been posted in the month since —365, to be exact. They seem to follow suit, alleging the same iPhone 5 time/date problem on Verizon Wireless service. Incorrect times varied from person to person — one complained that their phone was off by 15 days, six hours, and 12 minutes. Source: pcmagDOTcom/article2/0,2817,2411186,00.asp
